SEARCH
Package com.telos.loops.transport

Interface Transport

All Known Implementing Classes:
NoopTransport, OkHttpTransport
public interface Transport
Interface for HTTP transport implementations in the Loops SDK.

This interface abstracts the HTTP client layer, allowing different HTTP client implementations to be used with the SDK. The default implementation uses OkHttp via OkHttpTransport.

Default Implementation

The SDK uses OkHttpTransport by default, which provides:

  • HTTP/2 support
  • Connection pooling
  • Automatic retry for failed connections
  • Efficient resource usage

Custom Implementations

You can implement this interface to use a different HTTP client or add custom behavior like logging, metrics collection, or request/response modification.

Example: Custom Transport with Logging


 public class LoggingTransport implements Transport {
     private final Transport delegate;
     private final Logger logger;

     public LoggingTransport(Transport delegate, Logger logger) {
         this.delegate = delegate;
         this.logger = logger;
     }

     @Override
     public TransportResponse execute(TransportRequest request) {
         logger.info("Request: {} {}", request.httpMethod(), request.url());
         long start = System.currentTimeMillis();

         try {
             TransportResponse response = delegate.execute(request);
             long duration = System.currentTimeMillis() - start;
             logger.info("Response: {} ({}ms)", response.statusCode(), duration);
             return response;
         } catch (Exception e) {
             logger.error("Request failed", e);
             throw e;
         }
     }

     @Override
     public CompletableFuture<TransportResponse> executeAsync(TransportRequest request) {
         logger.info("Async request: {} {}", request.httpMethod(), request.url());
         long start = System.currentTimeMillis();

         return delegate.executeAsync(request)
             .whenComplete((response, error) -> {
                 long duration = System.currentTimeMillis() - start;
                 if (error != null) {
                     logger.error("Async request failed ({}ms)", duration, error);
                 } else {
                     logger.info("Async response: {} ({}ms)",
                         response.statusCode(), duration);
                 }
             });
     }
 }

Example: Custom Transport with Proxy


 public class ProxyTransport implements Transport {
     private final OkHttpClient client;

     public ProxyTransport(String proxyHost, int proxyPort) {
         Proxy proxy = new Proxy(Proxy.Type.HTTP,
             new InetSocketAddress(proxyHost, proxyPort));
         this.client = new OkHttpClient.Builder()
             .proxy(proxy)
             .build();
     }

     @Override
     public TransportResponse execute(TransportRequest request) {
         OkHttpTransport transport = new OkHttpTransport(client);
         return transport.execute(request);
     }

     @Override
     public CompletableFuture<TransportResponse> executeAsync(TransportRequest request) {
         OkHttpTransport transport = new OkHttpTransport(client);
         return transport.executeAsync(request);
     }
 }

Implementation Requirements

When implementing this interface, ensure that:

  • Both execute(com.telos.loops.transport.TransportRequest) and executeAsync(com.telos.loops.transport.TransportRequest) methods handle all HTTP methods (GET, POST, PUT, DELETE)
  • Request headers from TransportRequest.headers() are properly set
  • Request body from TransportRequest.body() is sent when present
  • Response headers are captured in TransportResponse.headers()
  • Response body bytes are captured in TransportResponse.response()
  • HTTP status code is returned in TransportResponse.status()
  • Network failures throw appropriate exceptions
  • Thread safety is maintained for concurrent requests

Note: Currently, the SDK does not expose a way to inject custom transports via the public API. This is planned for a future release.

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type
    Method
    Description
    TransportResponse
    execute(TransportRequest request)
    Executes an HTTP request synchronously.
    CompletableFuture<TransportResponse>
    executeAsync(TransportRequest request)
    Executes an HTTP request asynchronously.

  • Method Details

    • execute

      TransportResponse execute(TransportRequest request)
      Executes an HTTP request synchronously.

      This method blocks until the HTTP request completes and a response is received.

      Parameters:
      request - the HTTP request to execute
      Returns:
      the HTTP response
      Throws:
      RuntimeException - if the request fails due to network error, timeout, or other issues

    • executeAsync

      CompletableFuture<TransportResponse> executeAsync(TransportRequest request)
      Executes an HTTP request asynchronously.

      This method returns immediately with a CompletableFuture that will be completed when the HTTP request finishes.

      Parameters:
      request - the HTTP request to execute
      Returns:
      a CompletableFuture that will complete with the HTTP response
